results.title: Beethoven. Beethoven's 2nd
results.brief_description: Beethoven: Kidnapped from a pet store, an energetic St. Bernard puppy manages to escape from his kidnappers. He flees into the Newton house where he is discovered by the youngest child, Emily. Her siblings Ryce and Ted, and their mother, Alice (Bonnie Hunt), join forces to convince family patriarch George (Charles Grodin) that they should keep the puppy. Despite not being an animal lover, George agrees, and Beethoven becomes a member of the Newton family. Helping Ryce get the attention of the boy she likes, saving Ted from bullies and Emily from drowning are just some of the adventures the over-sized destructive dog gets up to. When an evil vet (Dean Jones) needs a big dog for one of his experiments, Beethoven is his first choice and the family have to race against time to stop the vet from experimenting on their beloved pet. Cast also includes Oliver Platt, Stanley Tucci, David Duchovny and Patricia Heaton. “Beethoven’s 2nd”: The original cast reunite in the sequel to the 1992 film about Beethoven, the oversized, slobbering member of the Newton family. Beethoven meets a St. Bernard named Missy at the park and falls in love and soon Beethoven and Missy are the proud parents of four. Unfortunately, Missy is a pawn in her owner’s divorce and while Regina (Debi Mazar) sees her as a way of getting a better settlement from her ex-husband, she has no interest in the puppies. When Ted and Emily overhear Regina’s orders for the puppies to be drowned, they kidnap them and hide them in the family basement. Dolly, Mo, Tchaikovsky and Chubby are impossible to keep quiet and George eventually discovers what his children have been hiding from him. Agreeing to keep the puppies until they are old enough to be given away, George and family - puppies included, go on holiday to a mountain retreat. While there, they are spotted by Regina who has decided that the pure bred puppies will earn her quite a bit of money. In true Cruella de Ville style, she steals the puppies and it is up to Beethoven and the Newtons to find the puppies before they are sold. Also stars Chris Penn.

results.title: Beethoven piano trio
results.brief_description: A performance of the slow movement of the piano trio (nicknamed “The Ghost”) with an analysis of the themes and structure of the movement. No credits available.

results.title: Beethoven or boogie?
results.brief_description: An appreciation of music is instilled in a Youth Club; the members form a Music Group and give a concert to raise money to purchase a radiogram. No other credits available.

results.title: Beethoven and his music
results.brief_description: The music of Beethoven reflects the great social upheaval of the late eighteenth century, the composer’s own unusual strength and genius and the transition from the classic formality of Haydn and Mozart to more romantic expression. The film develops the relationships between Beethoven’s environment and his personal response to it in terms of his music. Excerpts from the following are included in the film. First and Fourth Movement of the Symphony No. 5; The First Movement of the Violin Sonata, Opus 12 no. 2; the First Movement of the Archduke Trio, Opus 97; the First Movement of the Symphony No. 3 “Eroica”; the Piano Sonata No.14, Opus 27, No. 2 “Moonlight”; and the First Movement of the Symphony no. 6 “Pastoral”; the First Movement of the Piano Concerto No. 5 “Emperor”. No other credits available.

results.title: Beethoven
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Marre and Anvil Films and Record Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Composers”.
This film deals with Beethoven’s music up to 1806. John Ogden at the piano plays the “Appassionata” from the “Tempest Sonata” and with Brenda Lucas the early “Sonata for four hands”. Von Karajan conducts Symphony no. 3 (the “Eroica”) op. 55 and the Gabrielli Quartet plays “Rasoumoffsky Quartet” no.2 op.59.

results.title: Beer
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Presents an examination of beer production. Indicates the processing stages, and the resulting outputs of products, by-products and wastes. Chemical processes in fermentation are also considered. The program lends itself to students developing a flow chart of the manufacturing system, with inputs of various values, quantities and types.

results.title: Beef cattle in Australia
results.creator_credit: Fred Whatham and Cine Australian Productions
results.brief_description: A concise description of the Australian beef cattle industry, covering such aspects as marketing, breeding, mustering and transportation. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Beef business
results.creator_credit: B. Salt, A. Frank Bundy, British Information Services and Wallace Productions
results.brief_description: A film showing the best ways of making beef production profitable through different methods of grazing, feeding, breeding and marketing.
